xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors

Class NearestNeighborQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<DistanceWeightedKPE>
      • xxl.core.spatial.geometries.cursors.NearestNeighborQuery
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<DistanceWeightedKPE>, Cursor<DistanceWeightedKPE>

    public class NearestNeighborQuery
extends AbstractCursor<DistanceWeightedKPE>
    The NearestNeighborQuery is a priority based query which returns all neighbors of a given query object sorted by their distance to the query object. There is already a NearestNeighborQuery implemented in ORTree but this operator just considers the distance of the index-entries' MBRs, but does not take into consideratoin that there may be a difference between this distance and the distance of the indexed geometries. Therefor in this implementation the geometries extracted from the leafs are organised in a priority queue ordered by the distance, too. If the distance of the first element of this queue is less then the distance of the head of the candidate-queue this geometry is returned, otherwise the geommetry of the candidate is extracted and inserted into the geometry-queue.
